","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mljq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q2vk","text":"BACKGROUND

This document describes the required protocol to conduct insert name of the method/protocol.

Summary

Insert a short description of the background for the method/protocol (e.g. why and for which purpose do you perform water sampling).
Please provide a brief summary of your method including, as appropriate, a brief description of what techniques your best practice is about, which ocean environments or regions it targets, the primary sensors covered, what type of data/measurements/observing platform it covers, limits to its applicability.

Method description and rationale

Insert a short description of the functioning principal of the methodology used in the protocol (i.e. how does the method work?). Please note that this is different from the step-by-step description of the protocol procedure.
Insert a short statement explaining why the specific methodology used in the protocol has been selected (e.g. it is highly reproducible, highly accurate, procedures are easy to execute etc….).

Spatial coverage and environment(s) of relevance

If applicable, please specify the region where the protocol is applied. For regional term guidance see here. If applicable, please indicate here the environment(s) of relevance for the protocol, e.g. Abyssal plain. Select from the ENVO terminology.

Personnel Required
Insert the number of technicians, data managers, and scientists required for the good execution of the procedure

Safety

Identify hazards associated with the procedure and specify protective equipment and safety training required to safely execute the procedure

Training requirements

Specify technical training required for the good execution of the procedure.

Time needed to execute the procedure

Specify how much time is necessary to execute the protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"1mo49","text":"Insert all references cited in the document.\n\nPlease insert full DOI address when available, e.g. http://doi.dx.org/10.1007/s11258-014-0404-1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

related_materials.name: QIAgen DNeasy Blood and Tissue Kit, 50 rxn

entries.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2

status.info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

steps.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2sesr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7kan","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5jndm","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6k2c3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9gnhu","text":"We are aiming to do about 20 samples per day, but you can aim for less than that until you get comfortable with the protocol. # of samples that can fit in the Clean room 1 centrifuge – Megafuge = 16 (50 mL canonical tubes), Froggabio microcentrifuge = 12 (1.5 mL eppendorf tubes). # of samples that can fit in the Clean room 2 centrifuge – 16 x 50 mL conical tubes, 30 x 2 mL tubes.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"246E6E508CE443FBAB4A7DDA43BAE2F4"}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"4104C6D4341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"QIAgen DNeasy Blood and Tissue Kit, 50 rxn","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"69504","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/shop/sample-technologies/dna-sample-technologies/genomic-dna/dneasy-blood-and-tissue-kit?cmpid=QVenSPP1404quartzySC","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/products/","name":"Qiagen"}}}}}

steps.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"apdju","text":"Set aside ATL buffer, AL buffer, proteinase K, RNase A and anhydrous ethanol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahilb","text":"Put the ATL and AL buffers in the incubator to eliminate any precipitate that may be in the solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":101}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpnu6","text":"There is a cardboard box in the mini freezer with pro K aliquots. Each aliquot has enough volume for 12 samples. The anhydrous ethanol is stored in the CR1 mini fridge, and in the CR2 in the mini freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"42g7t","text":"Calculate the volume of each reagent you will need for each step and have a one-time-use tube to make an aliquot for that specific reagent. Try to add a little bit more than you need and dispose of the left over. Prepare the aliquots inside the workstation (with HEPA filter).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":213,"length":63}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bula0","text":"Cut the parafilm to a size of 1 cm x 5 cm, two or three per Sterivex – sometimes you will need to replace the parafilm in the Sterivex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bduih","text":"Wipe down the benches, centrifuge, and working areas using the PREempt solution/wipes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2er58","text":"Turn on the incubator and set the temperature to  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"56","unit":10}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8he2u","text":"Thaw the Sterivex filters.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8iv8","text":"Remove the parafilm and remove Longmire’s buffer/SLB using a syringe. You can use a plastic “tripour” to dispose the buffer and then pour all of the volume in the sink. Rinse the tripour with water after use, dry and wipe it down using a paper towel and PREempt solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":169,"length":102}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39h2t","text":"If needed, dry the Sterivex inlet using a Kimwipes (one wipe per Sterivex). Place the Sterivex on a clean Kimwipe while preparing the other one Sterivexes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8nt3i","text":"Add 0.1 mm silica beads (about 0.3 g or three spoons*) into the Sterivex using a weighting paper (make a funnel with the paper to slide in the beads, use one per Sterivex). *It is a white spoon that is stored in the drawer with the silica beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":25,"length":28},{"style":"italic","offset":174,"length":71}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bdl24","text":"Seal the outlet port of the Sterivex filter unit with the parafilm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kkop","text":"Inject   ATL buffer into the Sterivex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ab7l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"720","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63fue","text":"One more Sterivex +ATL buffer should be prepared for the extraction blank for detecting contamination during DNA extraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f76t9","text":"Place the Sterivex in the vortex adapter and do the “bead-beating” for   to promote cells lysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":71,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ufap","text":"Get one 50mL tube per sample, and put the Sterivexes inside the 50mL tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pba9","text":"Incubate the Sterivex at   for   using the rotisserie.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":31,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"56","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b37mj","text":"Repeat the steps 8 and 9 once again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"261c3","text":"Add   proteinase-K to each Sterivex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"699jh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"80","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ap7ko","text":"Seal the outlet port of the Sterivex filter unit with a parafilm if you notice that some lysate is leaking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"92oj9","text":"Vortex tubes for ~10 s (or simply move it to mix the solution). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"do8sh","text":"Place the Sterivexes back to the 50mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp22m","text":"Incubate tubes at   for   using the rotisserie.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":24,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ds1h6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"56","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"21pct","text":"While warming the Sterivex filter unit to  , prepare a 2.0 mL tube for DNA recovery (loBind DNA tubes). Note: write the necessary information on the cap of the 2.0 mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":104,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6d24b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"56","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6o274","text":"After completion of warming, carefully remove the parafilm and the luer fitting on the inlet port of the Sterivex filter unit, while preventing liquid inside from leaking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23bfm","text":"Insert the inlet port of the Sterivex filter unit into the 2.0 mL tube and lightly push it down to the bottom of the 50mL conical tube. Then, close the cap of the conical tube firmly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15c7h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7indg","text":"Put the conical tubes in the Megafuge adapters. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dga1r","text":"Centrifuge the conical tube containing the Sterivex filter unit at 6,000 x g for   and collect the extracted DNA in a 2 mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":81,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aj0sc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":0,"preset":[],"start":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3h0im","text":"Remove the 50 mL conical tube from the centrifuge and remove the Sterivex filter unit and 2.0 mL tube using tweezers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apk5k","text":"Note: The 2.0 mL tube is uncapped; handle it carefully. Wipe down the tweezers with PREempt wipes between samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4bebn","text":"Discard the used conical tubes (keep one conical tube and use it as a provisory waste container) and Sterivex filter unit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":32,"length":65}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ah5dv","text":"Firmly cap the 2.0 mL tube and proceed with these vials and lysate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqerj","text":"Add   of RNAse A ( ). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9v9d2","text":"Mix pipetting up and down (or vortexing). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsbsj","text":"Incubate at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":12,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cvn3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"100","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":204}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":0,"preset":[],"start":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"auouk","text":"Add   buffer AL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"224j8","text":"Mix thoroughly pipetting up and down (or by vortexing). It may form some precipitate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55ndo","text":"Incubate at   for   (it doesn’t need to be in the rotisserie).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":12,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bbi8q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"56","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ok1e","text":"Add   ethanol (96-100%). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"921t0","text":"Mix thoroughly pipetting up and down (or by vortexing). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14i47","text":"Total volume now is ~1.2 mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1tiga","text":"Pipette   the mixture into a DNeasy mini spin column placed in a 2 mL collection tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cseat","text":"Place the tubes in the centrifuge and spin the tubes at 8,000 rpm (~6,000 x g) for  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":83,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fn98f","text":"Discard the flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"600","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a4p2g","text":"Repeat the step 22 once again using the remaining volume of the mixture from step 21.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6oopj","text":"Place the spin column in a new 2 mL collection tube. If after spinning down you still can see some buffer in the spin column, centrifuge the tube again with a higher speed (about 10,000 x g). If this still not work, spin down with a higher speed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":53,"length":193}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5a6k","text":"Add   buffer AW1. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7877m","text":"Centrifuge for   at 8,000 rpm (~6,000 x g). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":15,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4hn1f","text":"Discard the flow through and collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m0io","text":"Place the spin column in a new 2 mL collection tube. Add   buffer AW2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":57,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"14vit","text":"Centrifuge for   at 14,000 rpm (~20,000 x g). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":15,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2s2mv","text":"Discard the flow through and collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6gt13","text":"Transfer the spin column to a new 1.5 mL or 2 mL microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4o01j","text":"Elute the DNA by adding   buffer AE to the center of the spin column membrane. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"be7ue","text":"Incubate for   at  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":13,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b52er","text":"Centrifuge for   at 8,000 rpm (~6,000 x g).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":15,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"46idb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":0,"preset":[],"start":0}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"15-20","unit":32}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9735o","text":"OPTIONAL: repeat the step 27 for increased DNA yield.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ctkot","text":"UV for 30 minutes the following:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24hqr","text":"Silica beads - you will need a 5mL tube full of beads to extract DNA from 12 samples ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ihuj","text":"(See bench top guide in the end of this protocol to check the amount of tubes you will need)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":90}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bekcv","text":"2mL tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aiq0u","text":"50mL falcon tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6onia","text":"Racks","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"av7d4","text":"Pipettes ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jvsj","text":"pipette tips","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"677me","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73ioq","text":"Do not forget to UV tubes for that will be used to aliquot the buffers, and silica beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":90}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
